title: Delineating and Sub-classifying Depressional Wetlands with Gradient Analysis of Littoral Vegetation Using Sentinel-2A Vege-Tation Indices
content: (1) Background: Depressional wetlands are highly vulnerable to changes in temperature and rainfall, affecting littoral vegetation, thus HydroGeoMorphic (HGM) wetland types. This study aimed to assess the utility of Sentinel-2A vegetation indices in enhancing delineation and sub-classify depressional HGM types. (2) Methods: We sampled 84 pairs of four vegetation indices from 10x10m plots along 14 belt transects in eight depressional wetlands in Mpumalanga, South Africa.
